wikipedia_page.main: James T. Tebbs (May 1878 – after 1901) was an English professional footballer who made 37 appearances in the Football League playing for Loughborough and Small Heath. He played as an outside left.Tebbs was born in Melton Mowbray, Leicestershire. He played in the Second Division for Loughborough, and was the club's leading scorer – with only 4 goals out of the 18 they scored – in the 1899–1900 season, Loughborough's last in the Football League. He then joined Small Heath, but the form of Sid Wharton restricted Tebbs to four appearances in two years, and he then returned to Leicestershire to play non-league football for Leicester United.

response: By mid-May, all the first-team players apart from Sid Wharton and Billy Bennett had signed on for the coming season,;"Scraps". Birmingham Daily Post: p.9. 7 May 1900. and those two later did so. Tom Farnall, who had had little first-team football, moved on to Watford, and Bob Cain, whose season had been ruined by injury, returned home to Sheffield. James Tebbs, an outside left, signed from Loughborough,'Spider' (24 August 1900). "Football Arrows". The Birmingham Pictorial and Dart: p.10. and a number of young players joined the squad. The Dart took a positive view: "The Heathens mean making a great attempt to gain admission into the 'charmed circle' this season, and if they will only perform a little more consistently away from home I think they will just about accomplish the feat."'Spider' (31 August 1900). "Football Arrows". The Birmingham Pictorial and Dart: p.10.
